Journal Story: Officially, 3 months to the start - I'm excited!
This will be my main mechanism of communication with my support community - trying to learn the ins and outs...be patient with me - lol!

It's REAL - reservations for GA trip and accommodations have been made and are locked in - how exciting! I will miss those I love and the comforts of our home yet the WAIT for this anticipated journey is coming to a close!
The time is flying - making this entry from phone to ensure I know what I’m doing - lol! My support system is strong, excited, and concerned. I greatly appreciate it all!
Heading to GA in 4 weeks - wow - making final tweaks and preparations as the time winds down....quickly. I greatly appreciate all of the support pouring in!

It’s very hard to believe I have less than 3 weeks to go. Lots of last minute items surfacing along with visits with loved ones. Enjoying reading journals of fellow hikers already underway. Safe travels!
Due to a dental issue, my start date is delayed until early April.
Glad to report I am progressing from the darn tooth issue. Thanks to my dental team expediting the process, I plan to start my AT journey on April 11th!
Excitement flourishes!!! Final preparations for bounce box and early mail drops. Enjoying journals and videos of fellow 2019 thru-hikers; grateful for additional time at home with loved ones!

It’s beyond realistic - as I make final preparations to embark on this “lifelong” pilgrimage, emotions are all over the place. Unwavering is my desire and passion to undertake this physical, mental, and spiritual journey. The support from everyone is very overwhelming - thank you!!!
Thank you, Mother Nature - what a send off! Heading to GA via bus / train - thank you, Jeanie!!

Phew - arrived in Gainesville via train and shuttled by Ron Brown (highly recommended) to Amicalola State Park. Registered as hiker #2099 with associated orientation. Because I’m staying at lodge tonight, I decided to do waterfalls piece of approach trail (thanks Ron). Emotions were very high as I started the walk forward and found myself reflecting a lot. These tired legs took the steps up the falls very slowly and I cherished every aspect of it. Settled in and ready for long sleep! Bring on tomorrow! Love to all I love!
Modified "approach trail" via Len Foote Inn Hiking Trail. Met some great folks along the way!

Started in the rain. Welcomed "hitting" the official Approach trail intersection - beautiful path! Enjoyed a nice lunch and break at Black Gap Shelter. Was welcomed by a "ridge runner", Captain Planet, who ended up becoming a trail angel for me as once I hit the summit, my hike came to a quick end....plagued with an excruciating foot pain.

I had prayed my chronic foot issue would meld into the trail; it has turned into excruciating pain. I’m in a trail town pursuing considerations and potential resolve to determine if I can continue. I’ll post again as soon as I know. As always - all the love, prayers, and support are greatly appreciate!

.... only not by foot. After yesterday’s consultation, it’s best not to get back on trail. I’ve decided to go home and pursue treatment options. I’m incredibly sad and disappointed, yet overwhelmed by all of the love, thoughts / prayers, and support coming my way. I put a lifelong dream into motion, enjoyed the steps and beauty of the “journey”, and still “....have promises to keep and miles to go before I sleep....”. I’ll figure out how to embrace the trail in some other way.

I made it home safely. I have a doctor's appointment Wednesday to determine cause of foot pain and "path" forward. The outpouring of support is VERY overwhelming! Thank you to all! Safe travels to fellow 2019 hikers.
My AT hiking days are done for 2019 - doctor's visit revealed fractured left foot. The good news - it will heal, with rest, within 4 - 6 weeks AND hiking is still a future option!
